definition: body/life/oneself/personally/one's morality and conduct/the main part of a structure or body/pregnant/classifier for sets of clothes: suit, twinset/Kangxi radical 158
board/plank/plate/shutter/table tennis bat/clappers (music)/CL:塊|块[kuai4]/accented beat in Chinese music/hard/stiff/to stop smiling or look serious
erhua variant of 身板[shen1 ban3]

sentences.english: And you , fucking tell him now . what geezer.
sentences.chinese: 就一個老頭子而言，你的身板兒還挺不錯的。

sentences.english: Fresh air and exercise are good for health.
sentences.chinese: 新穎空氣和運動有好處於身板健康。

sentences.english: He was broad and tall, with ghost-pale skin and thinning white hair.
sentences.chinese: 他身板寬大，個子很高，面無血色，一頭稀疏的白髮。

sentences.english: B sound mind in a sound body.
sentences.chinese: 健全的精力寓於康健的身板。

sentences.english: You're in pretty good shape for a geezer .
sentences.chinese: 就一個老頭子而言，你的身板兒還挺不錯的。

sentences.english: Your body can take the time necessary to metabolize fats.
sentences.chinese: 你的身板需要足夠的時間來把脂肪代謝掉。

definition: erhua variant of 身板[shen1 ban3]
too weak to stand up to the wind (idiom); extremely delicate/fragile state of health
